intro: Isachne micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered isachne, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, clustered inflorescence produces tiny, two-lipped flowers that are usually pale green to brown in color. Isachne micrantha plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and provides habitat for various small invertebrates.
